definition: to have children/to raise or bring up/to educate

sentences.english: Illustrated under the direction of Robert Kretschmer (1818–1872), they met with wide approval from the educated bourgeoisie.
sentences.chinese: 它們獲得了資產階級教育界的廣泛認可。

sentences.english: That film caused public revulsion, not least among the education circles.
sentences.chinese: 該電影引起公憤，特別是教育界的深惡。

sentences.english: The giants of management education have laboured mightily to bring forth a molehill.
sentences.chinese: 這些管理學教育界的巨頭們實在是徒勞微功。

sentences.english: He creates a Five- Five teaching mode which is appreciated by the education circle.
sentences.chinese: 自創五五制教學模式深得教育界肯定。

sentences.english: It shows that the tradition of "honouring the teacher and respecting his teaching" is still deeply ingrained among Chinese teachers here.
sentences.chinese: 這反映了華文教育界尊師重道的傳統依然根深蒂固。

sentences.english: Education may explain some of their sexual satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 教育界或許能解釋造成她們性滿足的因素。

sentences.english: Zhao Henglie was also known as an outstanding educational leader and organizer in China.
sentences.chinese: 趙恆烈還堪稱我國曆史教育界優秀的領導者和組織者。

sentences.english: But it is a pity, many people inside and outside educational circles lose understanding to it.
sentences.chinese: 但遺憾的是，教育界內外不少人對之理解失之偏頗。

sentences.english: The company is willing to cooperate in good faith and the education sector colleagues, Tongchuang a better future.
sentences.chinese: 公司願真誠與教育界同仁合作，同創美好未來。

sentences.english: Apparently, the artist aims at a serious problem occurring in the educational circle.
sentences.chinese: 很清楚作畫者意在指責當今教育界中的一個嚴重問題。

definition: all-round education (contrasted with 應試教育|应试教育[ying4 shi4 jiao4 yu4], exam-oriented education)
